title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.19 Part 3 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 27-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: You do good actions, everything is fine. If you do sinful activity you will suffer.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of discussion, verse 1.17.19 of Srimad Bhagavatam, and outlines three philosophical viewpoints: karma mimamsa, atheistic Sankhya, and atomic philosophy.

segments.key_quote: So, the Vedic conception of a material atom is different than the understanding of a material atom as given by today's scientists.
segments.summary: The speaker analyzes the defects in atomic philosophy, contrasting the Vedic concept of an indivisible atom with the modern scientific understanding of atoms consisting of subatomic particles.

segments.key_quote: So, atomic time to universal time is nicely explained in the third canto of the Bhagavatam and other places in the Vedic scriptures.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the Vedic concept of time, from atomic time to universal time, highlighting the relative nature of time based on different planetary systems and referencing the duration of Brahma's day as described in the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: In the spiritual world there are no laws of karma, there are only laws of god which is the law of eternity.
segments.summary: The speaker continues explaining the calculation of time in relation to Brahma's day and night, contrasting the material world governed by karma with the eternal spiritual world beyond creation and destruction.

segments.key_quote: He does not know about spiritual atom which is smaller than the material atom. What is that spiritual atom? The individual spirit soul.
segments.summary: The speaker criticizes Kanada Rishi's atomic philosophy for focusing solely on the material atom and neglecting the spiritual atom (the individual soul) and the Supreme Soul (Krishna), ultimately deeming it a defective philosophy.
